body_html:
@tatatodd Sorry, I didn't mention that.

  1. The configuration of machines is almost identical. The difference is only in OS - first machine is Ubuntu 14.04, the second one is Ubuntu 12.04. The rest are the same: Python 2.7.6, tensorflow - r0.10.

Also, tested this case on Mac OS and the result is similar: Tensor name "dnn_logits/biases" not found in checkpoint files

  1. Yes, when I run on each machine individually, everything work. The problem is transferring model from one machine to the other.

I tried to do on the contrary: created and fit the model (iris example) on the Mac, then copied the directory with model to the Ubuntu and again the same error has been shown up: Tensor name "dnn/hiddenlayer_0/biases" not found in checkpoint.

The model on Mac stays reusable and works.

P.S. Actually, I'm using skflow, but seems people are posting skflow's issues here too.
body_text:
@tatatodd Sorry, I didn't mention that.

The configuration of machines is almost identical. The difference is only in OS - first machine is Ubuntu 14.04, the second one is Ubuntu 12.04. The rest are the same: Python 2.7.6, tensorflow  - r0.10.

Also, tested this case on Mac OS and the result is similar: Tensor name "dnn_logits/biases" not found in checkpoint files

Yes, when I run on each machine individually, everything work. The problem is transferring model from one machine to the other.

I tried to do on the contrary: created and fit the model (iris example) on the Mac, then copied the directory with model to the Ubuntu and again the same error has been shown up: Tensor name "dnn/hiddenlayer_0/biases" not found in checkpoint.
The model on Mac stays reusable and works.
P.S. Actually, I'm using skflow, but seems people are posting skflow's issues here too.
body:
@tatatodd Sorry, I didn't mention that.  

1) The configuration of machines is almost identical. The difference is only in OS - first machine is Ubuntu 14.04, the second one is Ubuntu 12.04. The rest are the same: Python 2.7.6, tensorflow  - r0.10. 

Also, tested this case on Mac OS and the result is similar: Tensor name "dnn_logits/biases" not found in checkpoint files

2) Yes, when I run on each machine individually, everything work. The problem is transferring model from one machine to the other.

I tried to do on the contrary: created and fit the model (iris example) on the Mac, then copied the directory with model to the Ubuntu and again the same error has been shown up: _Tensor name "dnn/hiddenlayer_0/biases" not found in checkpoint_. 

The model on Mac stays reusable and works.

P.S. Actually, I'm using skflow, but seems people are posting skflow's issues here too.
